summary: 1996 PLYMOUTH BREEZE HAD SOMETHING BREAK FROM THE VEHICLE. THE CONSUMER STATED THE VEHICLE STALLED AND CAUGHT FIRE AFTER COMING TO A REST ON THE SHOULDER.  *KB  THE CAUSE OF THE FIRE WAS UNDETERMINED. (OHIO TRAFFIC CRASH REPORT)*JB

I WAS COMING HOME ONE EVENING FROM TOWN, AND MY BRAKES FAILED TO STOP.  THE  BRAKE PEDAL WENT ALL THE WAY TO THE FLOORBOARD AND NEVER ONCE SLOWED ME DOWN AND I CRASHED INTO ANOTHER VEHICLE. IT WAS A PRETTY BAD WRECK AND LUCKILY NO ONE WAS SERIOUSLY INJURED.  *JB
THE PLASTIC ADJUSTMENTS ON THE SEAT BELTS HAVE FALLEN OFF 2 OF THE SEAT BELTS, THEREFORE, I ASSUME, THEY ARE NO LONGER SAFE TO USE.  *NM

APPROXIMATELY THREE WEEKS AGO, AFTER MAKING A LEFT TURN, I NOTICED THE STEERING WHEEL BECAME DIFFICULT TO TURN.  THE PROBLEM WOULD DISAPPEAR AFTER BACKING UP. AND WAS NOT ALWAYS CONSISTENT. I BROUGHT IT INTO MY GARAGE WHO CHECKED THE BELTS AND FLUID. THEY REPORTED EVERYTHING WAS FINE.  YESTERDAY (2/22) LEAVING WORK I WAS MAKING A LEFT TURN OUT OF THE PARKING LOT INTO THE EXIT LANE, AND LOST ALL STEERING ABILITY. ANOTHER EMPLOYEE STOPPED TO SEE IF I NEEDED HELP. WHEN I TOLD HIM I LOST THE STEERING AGAIN AND ASKED IF HE COULD LOOK.  WHEN I OPENED MY DOOR TO GET OUT, FROM HIS HEIGHT HE COULD SEE SOMETHING STICKING OUT UNDERNEATH THE CLUTCH AREA. HE REACHED DOWN AND SAW THAT A CHUNK OF THE CLOTH MAT HAD BEEN SUCKED UP INTO THE STEERING COLUMN AT THE BASE OF THE FLOOR AND WAS WRAPPED FREEZING THE STEERING.  IT TOOK HIM A WHILE, BUT HE WAS EVENTUALLY ABLE TO FREE IT.  ALMOST THE ENTIRE, HEAVY CLOTH MAT WAS A GIANT BALL WRAPPED BY THE COLUMN. I WAS LUCKY THAT IT HAPPENED ON THE COMPANY CAMPUS ONLY MOVING A FEW MILES AN HOUR, AND NOT UP ON INTERSTATE 78 I TRAVEL EVERYDAY AT 55 MILES AN HOUR WHEN THE STEERING COMPLETELY FROZE. *JB

OIL NOTICED ON GROUND UNDER VEHICLE. MECHANIC SAYS HEAD GASKET IS LEAKING OIL OUT OF ENGINE. HEAD GASKET FAILURE IS CAUSING OIL TO BE LEAKED ONTO GROUND WHICH CAUSES ECOLOGICAL DAMAGE TO OUR ENVIRONMENT PER EPA. THIS WEB SITE DOCUMENTS THIS AS A TREND FOR THIS PLATFORM OF PLYMOUTH VEHICLE. THERE MUST BE TENS OF THOUSANDS OF GALLONS OF PETROLEUM OIL BEING SPILLED INTO OUR ENVIRONMENT BY THESE VEHICLES, MAYBE MORE. THESE VEHICLES ARE INJURING US ALL AND SHOULD NO LONGER BE USED UNLESS PROPERLY AND PERMANENTLY FIXED.  *NM

RECALL NOTICE REGARDING THE TRANSAXLE FLOOR SHIFTER IGNITION INTERLOCK SYSTEM ON THE 1996 PLYMOUTH BREEZE.*MR  THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TOT HE DEALER BUT THE REFUSED TO REPAIR THE VEHICLE UNDER THE R RECALL DUE TO VIN.  *NM

DT: WITH NO WARNING THE CAR JUST SHUTS OFF  WHILE DRIVING AND IN ALL WEATHER CONDITIONS. PROBLEM IS IN THE ELECTRICAL SYSTEM.  HAS HAD BATTERY RECHARGED AND WAS TOLD BY MANUFACTURER TO GET AN ELECTRONIC ANALYSIS TEST ON THE VEHICLE BUT THE TEST IS NOT FREE.   *NM

PROBLEMS GETTING REPAIR WORK COMPLETED ON 1996 PLYMOUTH BREEZE.*MR  WHEN THE CONSUMER RETURNED TO PICK UP HIS VEHICLE, HE WAS TOLD NO WORK HAD BEEN PERFORMED BECAUSE THERE WAS A SPECIAL PART THAT NEEDED TO ORDERED.  THE DEALER STILL HAS NOT CONTACTED THE CONSUMER.   THE PROBLEM WAS A RECALL REPAIR ON THE SHIFT INTER-LOCK. RECALL#04V021000.  *JB
WATER PUMP HAS BROKEN 4 TIMES IN THE LAST 5 YEARS . ALSO THE TIMING BELT WAS BROKEN 3 TIMES AND TENSIONER WAS BROKEN 2 TIMES ( ALL REPLACED WHEN WATER PUMP WAS BROKEN )-IN PLYMOUTH VOYAGER 1996.  *AK
AFTER TAKING THE VEHICLE IN TO THE DEALER ON A RECALL FOR THE PARK INTERLOCK THE DEALER CHARGED THE CONSUMER FOR PERFORMING THE REPAIRS.  *AK

WHILE PARKED ON A SLIGHT INCLINE WITH NO KEYS IN THE IGNITION, THE GEAR SHIFT OF THE FLOOR CONSOLE WAS ABLE TO BE MOVED. THE VEHICLE ROLLED AND HIT A HOUSE.  THE VEHICLE HAD A CHILD INSIDE AT THE TIME THAT SUSTAINED MINOR HEAD INJURIES.  THE OWNER RECEIVED A RECALL NOTICE ONE YEAR LATER. NHTSA RECALL CAMPAIGN 04V021000; FLOOR SHIFT CONSOLE.  PLEASE PROVIDE DETAILS.  *JB   *TC

components: ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING,FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE
summary: WHILE DRIVING VEHICLE  IDLED REAL HIGH, THEN SLOWED DOWN.   PUT THE KEY IN THE IGNITION AND THE VEHICLE STARTED UP, BUT IT DID NOT MOVE.  HAD A MECHANIC TO LOOK AT THE VEHICLE AND WAS TOLD THAT THE COMPUTER WAS BURNT OUT. THEN SHE HAD A SECOND OPINON, AND WAS TOLD THAT SHE HAD A FUEL PUMP AIR LEAK, AND THIS CAUSED HER TO HAVE POWER REDUCTION WHILE DRIVING.  SHE STATES SHE HAS NEVER RECEIVED A RECALL ON HER VEHICLE.*AK

1996 PLYMOUTH BREEZE 2.0 ENGINE LEAKS EXTREME AMOUNTS OF OIL FROM AREA WHERE UPPER, LOWER, AND FRONT SEAL COME TOGETHER. NOT THE SEAL ITSELF. ALSO SEEMS TO RUN HOT. IT IS NOT A PROBLEM CAUSED OVER TIME. IT IS NOT SEALED FROM NEW.  ALSO INTERIOR HAS COMPLETELY DETERIORATED AS IF IT WERE 50 YEARS OLD.  *LA

components: SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC,ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING,POWER TRAIN,VISIBILITY,STRUCTURE
summary: I PURCHASED MY 1996 PLYMOUTH BREEZE IN APRIL OF 1998 WITH 33,000 MILES ON IT AND IT CURRENTLY HAS 115,000 MILES ON IT.  THE INITIAL SIGNS OF PROBLEMS BEGIN AT 50,000 MILES WITH AN OIL LEAK NO ONE COULD SEEM TO FIX (NOT EVEN THE DEALERSHIP).  WITHIN A SPAN OF 82, 000 MILES:   I HAVE HAD TO REPLACE THE HEAD GASKET TWICE AT 54,000 AND 113,000 ($1000),   I HAVE HAD TWO MAJOR TUNE-UPS AT 60,000 AND 92,000 MILES ($500),   I HAVE HAD ALL SENSORS REPLACED AT 101,000 MILES ($1500),   I HAVE HAD THREE MAJOR BRAKE JOBS WITHIN 18 MONTHS ($1800),   I HAD TO REPLACE THE RADIATOR ($250),   I HAD TO HAVE THE CATALYTIC CONVERTER REPLACED AT 75,000 MILES ($350),   I HAD TO HAVE A NEW TRANSMISSION AT 95,000 MILES ($1500),   IVE HAD NUMEROUS REPAIRS BASED ON THE READOUTS FROM THE COMPUTER ($600+),  REPLACED THE OIL PAN GASKET BUT IT STILL LEAKS ($150)  THE WINDOW SEALS LEAK WHEN IT RAINS (NEVER TRIED TO FIX)  (THIS CAR SAT IN MY DRIVEWAY ALMOST ALL OF 2002 BECAUSE I COULD NOT AFFORD THE REPAIRS)  AFTER ALL OF MY FUTILE ATTEMPTS TO KEEP MY TRANSPORTATION OPERABLE, ITS CURRENTLY SITTING IN MY DRIVEWAY WITH THE FOLLOWING PROBLEMS:  IT CUTS OFF WHILE DRIVING,  THE ENGINE REVS UP AND DOWN WHEN IDLE,  THERE IS A SEVERE OIL LEAK THAT NO ONE CAN SEEM TO FIX,  THE ENGINE LIGHT STAYS ON NO MATTER WHAT REPAIRS ARE DONE,  THE FACTORY RADIO, THE SPEEDOMETER, AND THE MILEAGE GAUGE, NO LONGER WORK.  THERE IS ABSOLUTELY NO PICKUP WHEN DRIVING UP HILLS,  WHEN YOU TURN THE AC ON THERE IS AN UNBEARABLE HORRIBLE RATTLING NOISE AND THE CAR LOSES AN OBSCENE AMOUNT OF POWER AND FEELS AS THOUGH ITS GOING TO CUT OFF,  THERES A SCOWLING NOISE WHEN YOU TURN THE STEERING WHEEL LEFT TO RIGHT  IT TAKES 15 MINUTES IN ORDER FOR THE HEATER TO BLOW OUT WARM AIR.  AND I STILL OWE $6,000 ON THIS VEHICLE.  *JB

THE OIL CONSTANTLY LEAKS. THE HEAD GASKET HAS BEEN REPLACED THREE TIMES.  (1998, 2000, 2002). THE HEAD GASKET IS NOW WORN AGAIN AND NEEDS TO BE REPLACED.  THE TIMING BELT REPLACED ONCE DUE TO THE OIL LEAKING ON IT.  NOW THE TIMING BELT NEEDS TO BE REPLACED AGAIN

I ACQUIRED A 1996 PLYMOUTH BREEZE IN MARCH OF 2002.  THE DAY AFTER I GOT THE CAR, THE "CHECK ENGINE" LIGHT CAME ON.  SINCE THEN, THE LIGHT HAS COME ONE A TOTAL OF 4 TIMES.  EACH TIME IT HAS BEEN FIXED OR LOOKED AT, THE O2 SENSOR WAS THE CAUSE OF THE PROBLEM.  ON HALLOWEEN 2002, I TOOK MY CAR IN TO GET A ROUTINE OIL CHANGE AND TO FIND OUT THE CAUSE OF A TICKING SOUND.  THE AUTO CENTER (THAT WAS DOING MY OIL CHANGE) SAID IT WAS A ROD BEARING, BUT WHEN I TOOK THE CAR TO THE DEALERSHIP, THEY SAID THAT IT WAS A FLYWHEEL.  THE CAR WAS REPAIRED AND 2 DAYS AFTER I PICK UP THE CAR, THE "CHECK ENGINE" LIGHT COMES ON FOR THE 4TH TIME.  I AM TAKING THE CAR TO THE DEALERSHIP AND PRAYING THAT THIS IS THE LAST TIME I WILL HAVE TO MAKE ANY REPAIRS FOR THE SAME THING!!!

THE HEAD GASKET WAS REALLY THE PROBLEM THAT I HAVE THE BIGGEST BEEF ABOUT. I HAVE HAD AN OIL LEAK SINCE AT LEAST AUGUST 2002 AND THE MECHANIC THAT I'VE BEEN TAKING MY CAR TO HAS REPLACED THE OIL PRESSURE SWITCH TWICE AND MOST RECENTLY THE CAM SHAFT SWITCH. AT THE LAST REPAIR, HE INDICATED THAT I HAD A TORN HEAD GASKET, A VERY COMMON PROBLEM WITH MY MODEL OF CAR. I MADE AN APPOINTMENT WITH THE LOCAL CHRYSLER DEALER AND THEN CONTACTED CHRYSLER ABOUT SOME MONETARY ASSISTANCE WITH THIS REPAIR. CHRYSLER CONFIRMED THE PROBLEM WITH THE DEALER AND THEN DID NOTHING FOR TWO DAYS UNTIL I CALLED BACK AND FOUND OUT THAT THE DECISION RESTED IN THE REGIONAL MANAGER'S HANDS WHO WAS OUT OF TOWN ON VACATION FOR 4 MORE DAYS. I CONTACTED CHRYSLER AGAIN AND ESCALLATED THE DECISION THROUGH A FEW LEVELS OF MANAGEMENT AND FOUND THAT MY REQUEST HAD BEEN DENIED DUE TO THE AGE OF THE CAR AND ITS MILEAGE. THIS IRRITATES ME FOR SEVERAL REASONS. HEAD GASKETS ARE SUPPOSED TO HAVE A MUCH LONGER LIFE SPAN THAT 72K MILES. THIS IS A WELL DOCUMENTED DEFECT WITH THE CAR I HAVE AND I FEEL THAT A RECALL IS IN ORDER. FROM WHAT I'VE READ ON THE INTERNET, MANY BREEZE/NEON OWNERS HAVE HAD SUCCESS CONVINCING CHRYSLER TO PAY FOR SOME OF THE REPAIR. I BROUGHT MY CAR IN ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND IT WASN'T UNTIL THE END OF THE DAY ON THURSDAY THAT CHRYSLER MADE THEIR DECISION. IN THE MEANTIME, THE MECHANIC DID NOT REPAIR THE PROBLEM BECAUSE HE WAS WAITING ON THE RESPONSE FROM CHRYSLER. HENCE, I WAS OUT OF THE USE OF MY CAR AN ADDITIONAL TWO DAYS. ADDITIONALLY, I'VE ALREADY INCURRED ABOUT $400 IN EXPENSES MOST LIKELY RELATED TO THIS HEAD GASKET FROM PREVIOUS REPAIRS TO MY OIL LEAK PROBLEM. IT'S A SHAME ALL THIS HAPPENED BECAUSE I WAS PRETTY PLEASED WITH THE CAR UP UNTIL I DISCOVERED THIS PROBLEM.

1996 PLYMOUTH BREEZE INVOLVED IN ACCIDENT DUE TO EQUIPMENT FAILURE.*MR                THE ACCIDENT WAS THE RESULT OF STEERING PROBLEMS. CONSUME LATER RECEIVED A SAFETY RECALL NOTIFICATION FROM CHRYSLER THAT CONCERNED THE LOWER CONTROL ARMS AND BALL JOINTS. CONSUMER'S SON SUSTAINED INJURIES.  INSURANCE COMPANY DECLARED THE VEHICLE TOTALED. THE HEAD GASKET WAS REPLACED PRIOR TO THE ACCIDENT. DRIVER WAS MAKING A TURN WHEN HE HEAR A CLINKING OR POPPING SOUND. AT THE ENID OF THE TURN THE STEERING WHEEL WOULD NOT STEER THE VEHICLE. HE HIT THE CURB AND HEARD A LOUD SOUND UNDER THE VEHICLE. HE THEN HIT THE SIGN POLE, WHICH BROKE A THE BASE AND CAME THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD. HE HAD TO DUCK OUT OF THE WAY AS THE POLE HIT HIS HEADREST AND THEN STRUCK THE WALL. THIS IS WHERE HE INJURED HIS NECK AND BACK, TRYING TO AVOID THE POLE. THE AIR BAGS DIDN'T DEPLOY.  *PH
PASSENGER FRONT SIDE POWER WINDOW FAILED TO OPERATE PROPERLY.   WINDOW WOULD PERIODICALLY STICK WHEN DEPRESSING THE BUTTON TO MOVE WINDOW UP OR DOWN.*AK
CONSUMER  WAS INVOLVED IN A HEAD ON COLLISION. THE AIR BAG DEPLOYED AT 15 MPH WHICH CAUSED SEVERE INJURIES TO CONSUMER. DEALER NOTIFIED. PLEASE PROVIDE ADDITIONAL INFORMATION.   *PH

THE DEALER WAS CONTACTED FOR MONETARY ASSISTANCE WHICH WAS DISCUSSED WITH A FEW CHRYSLER REPRESENTATIVES AND THE REQUEST WAS DENIED. components: SERVICE BRAKES, HYDRAULIC,ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING,POWER TRAIN
summary: I'M SO DISAPPOINTED IN THIS CAR.  I BOUGHT IT NEW IN 1996, AND IT'S BEEN CONSTANT PROBLEMS SINCE I DID.  THE FIRST TIME THE HEAD GASKET WENT OUT, THE CAR WAS STILL UNDER WARRANTY, BUT HAS GONE OUT TWICE SINCE THEN.  I'VE SPENT SO MUCH MONEY ON REPAIRS, THAT I COULD HAVE BOUGHT A WHOLE NEW CAR IF YOU ADD IT ALL UP.  THE BRAKES ARE ALWAYS SQUEEKING AND WEARING OUT QUICKLY.  WHENEVER ONE THING GOES WRONG, IT'S QUICKLY FOLLOWED BY SEVERAL OTHER PROBLEMS.  MY TRANSMISSION HAD A MASSIVE LEAK LAST YEAR (2001) THAT TOOK THE DEALER TWO TIMES TO FIX.  BUT NOW IT'S LEAKING AGAIN.  I WENT AND BOUGHT A NEW KIA TWO DAYS AGO--BUT I'M RELUCTANT TO TRY AND SELL THIS LEMON TO ANYBODY.  IT HAS NO TRADE IN VALUE WHATSOEVER.  NOW THAT I'M AWARE OF THE MAJOR HEAD GASKET PROBLEMS, I WONDER IF THERE'S ANY SORT OF CLASS ACTION LAWSUIT AGAINST THE MAKERS OF PLYMOUTH?  I WANT MY MONEY BACK!!!*AK

THIS VEHICLE HAS BEEN NOTHING BUT PROBLEMS SINCE DAY ONE.CURRENTLY I'M LOOKING AT REPLACING THE WHOLE RACK IN THE FRONT END OF THE VEHICLE!!MY CAR IS 5 YEARS OLD HAS BEEN MAINTAINED PROPERLY AND IS MY FAMILY SEDAN.I AM A 33 YEAR OLD MOTHER AND HAVE NEVER DONE ANYTHING TO ABUSE OR NEGLECT THIS VEHICLE.IT LEAKS OIL,THE DOOR SEALS DON'T LINE UP PROPERLY ON THE BACK DOORS AND IT JUST SEEMS LIKE IT WON'T LAST THE TERM OF MY LOAN I TOOK OUT TO BUY THIS VEHICLE IN THE FIRST PLACE.I AM SO DISGUSTED WITH CHRYSLER MANUFACTURING SUCH A LEMON AND TURNING AROUND AND SELLING IT TO HAPLESS VICTIMS.PREYING ON FAMILIES THAT CAN BARELY AFFORD THERE VEHICLES.WHEN THAT SALESMAN LOOKED INTO MY 18 MONTH OLD DAUGHTERS EYES AT THE TIME DID IT EVEN MATTER TO HIM THAT HE MIGHT BE PUTTING HER LIFE IN DANGER BY SELLING HER PARENTS A POORLY DESIGNED AND BUILT CAR?OBVIOUSLY NOT.UNFORTUNATELY FOR PEOPLE LIKE MYSELF I CANNOT AFFORD TO TAKE THEM TO COURT FOR SELLING ME THIS LEMON AND NEEDING TO WORK EVERY DAY TO GET BY I NEEDED THIS VEHICLE.I HAVE TO DRIVE IT EVERY DAY.IT'S A SHAME THAT CHRYSLER HAS RUINED ANOTHER AMERICAN FAMILIES OPINION ON AMERICAN MADE VEHICLES BECAUSE I WILL NEVER BUY AMERICAN FOR VEHICLES AGAIN.THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME.*AK
WHILE MAKING LEFT TURN AT ABOUT 5-10 MPH TIE ROD FELL OFF, AND VEHICLE SKIDDED TO SIDE OF ROAD. *AK
GASKET BLOWN CAUSING OIL LEAK.   *JB
HEAD GASKET STARTED TO LEAK BUT DEALER WANTED $1500 TO FIX. NOW IT IS LEAKING VERY BAD.  *AK

I HAVE BEEN HAVING PROBLEMS WITH OIL DRIPPING FROM MY 1996 PLYMOUTH BREEZE. I TOOK IT TO MY MECHANIC, WHO TOLD ME THAT THE PROBLEM WAS A BAD HEAD GASKET. I WAS TOLD BY HIM THAT PLYMOUTH WAS HAVE A PROBLEM WITH THAT VEHICLE AND THAT SHOULD BE A RECALL ITEM. I CONTACTED CHRYSLER ABOUT MY PROBLEM AND THEY ADVISED THAT IT WASN'T A RECALLED PROBLEM, AND IT NEVER WILL BE. FOR THEM TO FIX IT ,IT WILL COST UPWARDS OF 2,000 DOLLARS. I HAVE TRIED TO REASON WITH THEM, BUT COULDN'T GET ANYWHERE WITH THEM. THE PROBLEM IS VERY MESSY FOR MY DRIVEWAY,AND PROBABLY A SAFETY CONCERN THE MORE I DRIVE IT ON THE ROAD. I HOPE NHTSA PUTS OUR CONCERNS TO THE FORFRONT AND GETS CHRYSLER TO ADDRESS OUR SITUATION AND FINALLY  PUT THE PROBLEM ON THE RECALL LIST. AS A FAN OF THE CHRSYLER PRODUCT AND BUYER, I HOPE THAT SOMETHING CAN BE DONE.             FRANK CORTEZ
ALOT OF THESE PROBLEMS SEEM TO BE PERSISTENT WITH THE PLYMOUTH,DODGE, AND CHRYSLER. THIS SHOULD BE DEALT WITH AND RESOLVED TO GRATIFY THE CONSUMER. NO SAFETY DEFECT LISTED. *AK
HEAD GASKET HAS BEEN REPLACED AT 32000 AND 42000 MILES. CONSUMER NOTICED A LOSS OF POWER, AND TOOK VEHICLE TO DEALER TO CHECK IT.  WAS INFORMED THAT  HEAD GASKET NEEDED TO BE CHANGED.  *AK
HEAD GASKET IS LEAKING.   *SLC

CONSUMER WAS GETTING AN OIL CHANGE, AND OIL WAS FOUND IN RADIATOR. GASKETS HAVE TO BE REPLACED BEFORE  ENGINE BLOWS.    MANUFACTURE WILL NOT APPROVE  COVERAGE FOR IT, AND HAS NOT ANNOUCED A RECALL.*AK

ONGOING OIL LEAK SINCE PURCHASED. FUEL PUMP WENT OUT. WAS TOLD REAR MAIN SEAL WAS GOING OUT OF CAR. OIL GETTING IN RADIATOR, MECH. SAID HEAD GASKETS WERE BAD. TIMING BELT BROKE WHILE DRIVING 65MPH, CAUSING PISTON TO BEND VALVE. FRONT BRAKES HAVE ALWAYS SQUEAKED WHEN RELEASING, AND HAS ALWAYS RATTLED BEHIND FRONT WHEELS WHEN GOING OVER BUMPS. WHAT A LEMON!! PROBLEMS SINCE PURCHASED!  ALOT OF PEOPLE HAVE PROBLEMS WITH THESE! THERE SHOULD BE RECALL ON THESE DUE TO HEAD GASKET PROBLEMS! I EXPECTED TO HAVE PROBLEMS, BUT NOT THIS SOON! PROBLEMS STARTED SOON AFTER PURCHASE, AND DEALER KEPT TELLING ME NOTHING WAS WRONG WITH IT!  THAT'S WHY I BOUGHT A NEWER MODEL CAR! MY KLUNKER RAN BETTER THAN THIS AND WITH LESS PROBLEMS! I WILL DEFINITELY THINK TWICE BEFORE BUYING ANOTHER CHRYSLER PRODUCT, ESPECIALLY AFTER READING ABOUT ALL THE PROBLEMS WITH HEAD GASKETS THAT SEEM TO BE GETTING IGNORED!!*AK

WHEN CAR IS PLACED IN PARK, THE KEY WILL STICK IN THE IGNITION.  MOTOR TURNS OFF, BUT INSIDE FUNCTIONS STAY ON (MILEAGE LIGHTS, RADIO/CLOCK) AND KEY WILL NOT TURN ALL THE WAY TO TAKE IT OUT.  AFTER TRYING OVER AND OVER, SOMETHING WILL "GIVE" IN THE IGNITION, AND THE KEY WILL FINALLY COME OUT.  ALSO, WHEN YOU LOCK THE DOORS, SOMETIMES THE POWER LOCK MOTOR WILL MAKE A "GROANING-WHINING" NOISE, AND NOT ALL OF THE DOORS WILL LOCK.  THESE PROBLEMS HAVE BEEN GOING ON SINCE SHORTLY AFTER PURCHASE.*AK
HEAD GASKET ON THIS CAR HAVE BEEN REPLACED 3 TIMES, THIS HAS TO BE A DEFECT AS I SEE ALOT OF OTHER PEOPLE HAVE HAD THE SAME PROBLEM.  *AK

summary: BRAKES NEEDED REPLACING 4 MONTHS AFTER BUYING CAR. DEALER SAID WAS NOT UNDER WARRANTY.  HAD COMPLETE BRAKE JOB ON FRONT 2 TIMES, 1 ON REAR, CYLINDER REPLACED, SHOES REPLACED, BRAKES STILL DO NOT WORK PROPERLY, SOMETHING COMES LOOSE IF PRESSED SUDDENLY CAUSING CAR TO SLIDE AND NOT STOP. PADS HAVE BEEN REPLACED NUMEROUS TIMES DUE TO QUICK WEAR OUT.  ACCIDENT COULD HAVE BEEN AVOIDED IF BRAKES WORKED PROPERLY. CAR DOES NOT STOP EFFICIENTLY. ALSO,ENGINE HEAD GASKET WAS REPLACED UNDER WARRANTY.  ENGINE HAS BEEN LEAKING OIL AGAIN SINCE 7/98.  DEALER MAINTAINS THAT I WILL HAVE TO REPAIR BECAUSE OUT OF WARRANTY.  OIL LIGHT DOES NOT WORK TO WARN WHEN OIL IS LOW. CONSTANTLY ADDING OIL TO KEEP AT PROPER LEVEL.  PARKING BRAKE HAS BEEN ADJUSTED SEVERAL TIMES BUT DOES NOT STAY LONG.  FUEL GAUGE GIVES INACCURATE READING.  APPEARS TO BE EMPTY WHEN NOT. AIR CONDITIONER QUIT MONTH BEFORE CAR ACCIDENT IN 8/99.  WAS REPAIRED WITH COLLISION REPAIRS. REPAIRS REVEAL PRIOR ACCIDENT BEFORE BUYING CAR.  WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THIS.  HAVE SPENT TOO MUCH MONEY ON THIS CAR IN TWO YEARS FOR CAR TO BE AS NEW AS IT IS.  THERE ARE OTHER DEFECTS THAT WILL BE REPORTED ON AN ADDITIONAL FORM.  *AK

summary: I PURCHASED A USED CAR, AND SOMETIMES YOU NEED TO FIX MINOR THINGS IF THE CAR IS OLD, BUT THIS CAR IS A 1996.  ALMOST STILL NEW AND I JUST DON'T UNDERSTAND HOW THE TRANSMISSION COULD BAD THIS SOON.  WHEN I BOUGHT THE CAR IT WAS LEAKING OIL SO I FIGURED IT WAS JUST SOMETHING SIMPLE.  I TOOK THE CAR INTO JIM EARP CHRYSLER-PLYMOUTH ON 55TH AND L STREET THEY TOLD ME I NEEDED TO REPLACE MY HEADGASKETS, AND BRAKES.I DID. THEY CAR WAS STILL LEAKING SO I TOOK IT BACK IN ON 6/10/99 BUT THEY COULD'T LOOK AT IT. I WENT TO ANOTHER DEALER THEY TOLD ME MY TRANSMISSION IS PROBALY CRACKED. I DO HAVE ANOTHER FRIEND WHO BOUGHT HIS CAR BRAND NEW AND THE SAME PROBLEM, HEADGASKETS WENT BAD, HIS ENGINE CRACKED, AND NOW HIS CAR IS IN THE SHOP FOR BAD TRANSMISSION.  MY CAR MAKES MORE NOISE NOW AND IT DIDN'T BEFORE. I DON'T KNOW HOW MANY OTHERS HAVE THIS PROBLEM BUT I KNOW 2 PEOPLE AND MYSELF ARE EXPERIENCING THE SAME PROBLEMS WITH THE PLYMOUTH BREEZE. *AK
VEHICLE WAS INVOVED IN A ACCIDENT AT 50-60 MPH BEFORE BRAKING WHICH CAUSE CONSUMER VEHICLE TO REAREND ANOTHER VEHICLE; BOTH AIR BAGS FAIL TO DEPLOYED MFR/DEALER WAS NOT NOTIFIED AT THIS TIME.
HEAD GASKET BLOWN.  NLM
WHILE DRIVING AT 45 MPH, A  TRAILER TRUCK PULLED OUT IN FRONT OF  CONSUMER'S VEHICLE, AND  CONSUMER HIT TRUCK ON THE SIDE. UPON IMPACT, DRIVER SIDE AND  PASSENGER'S SIDE AIR BAGS DIDN'T DEPLOY.  *AK

ORIGINALLY REPORTED TROUBLE TO LOCAL DEALERSHIP AND THEY ADVISED ME THAT THE PROBLEM WAS NOT COVERED BY WARRANTY AND THAT I SHOULD CONTINUE TO REPLACE LOST OIL AND THAT IT WAS NOT WORTH FIXING BECAUSE I WOULD PROBABLY WANT TO TRADE IT IN.  THEN WHEN I SCHEDUALED TO HAVE IT FIXED, ABOUT 9 MONTHS LATER, THEY ADVISED ME THAT THEY WOULD HAVE NEVER TOLD ME THAT AND THAT IT WAS COVERED UNDER WARRENTY.  BY THAT TIME OF COARSE I WAS OUT OF MILAGE WARRENTY.  I WENT AHEAD AND SENT IT IN TO HAVE THE HEAD GASKET REPARED OR REPLACED WHATEVER NEEDED TO BE DONE.  THEY TOLD ME AT THAT TIME THAT THERE WAS A NATIONAL BACK ORDER ON THE PART SO I DID NOT RECIEVE MY VEHICLE BACK FOR OVER A MONTH. THEN WHEN I DID GET IT BACK I NOTICED THAT IT WAS STILL LEAKING OIL SO I CALLED IMEDIATELY.  IT TOOK THEM 2 WEEKS TO GET IT BACK IN ONLY TO TELL ME WHAT I ALREADY NEW THAT THE HEAD GASKET WAS LEAKING AND IT NEED TO BE REPLACED.  I CALLED THEM EVER DAY TO CHECK ON THE PROGRESS AND WHAT THEY FINALLY TOLD ME WAS THAT THERE WAS A REDESIGN ON THE GASKETS BECAUSE THE ORIGINAL ONE HAD A DEFECT BUT THERE WAS NO RECALL ON THEM AND THAT THE FIRST ONE THAT THEY REPLACED WAS STILL THE OLD DESIGN SO THEY WOULD REPLACE IT AT NO CHARGE WITH THE NEW DESIGN BUT WHEN I FINALLY GOT MY CAR BACK IT WAS STILL LEAKING!  SO FAR I AM OUT OF OVER A $1000.00 IN REPAIR AND THAT IS NOT EVEN COUNTING THE COST OF RENTAL CARS.  *AK

ON NOVEMBER 15TH, 1998, MY HUSBAND WAS DRIVING OUR PLYMOUTH BREEZE ON HIS WAY TO WORK. WHILE DRIVING HE HEARD SEVERAL TERRIBLE, LOUD NOISES COMING FROM UNDER THE HOOD AND IMMEDIATELY LOSS POWER. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO AAMCO TRANSMITTIONS. AAMCO TRANSMITTIONS FOUND THE PROBLEM TO BE, THE DIFFERENTAL PIN WORKED ITS WAY OUT OF PLACE, CATCHING ITSELF ON METAL. THE DIFFERENTIAL PIN SPLIT INTO THREE PIECES (AAMCO BELIEVES). THE DIFFERENTIAL PIN MADE SEVERAL 3 INCH HOLES IN THE CASING OF THE TRANSMISSION. THE TRANSMISSION WAS CONTAMINATED AND DESTROYED. THE SOLUTION, TO REPLACE THE COMPLETE TRANSMISSION. THE PLYMOUTH BREEZE IN THIS REPORT HAS NOT EVER BEEN SERVICED FOR PROBLEMS OTHER THAN RECALLS. WE BELIEVE THE DAMAGE STARTED TO BEGIN WHILE THE CAR WAS STILL IN ITS WARRANTY LIFE. WE HAVE SPOKEN TO TWO CHRYSLER ENGINEERS, TWO TRANSMISSION SPECIALISTS, AND THREE CHRYLSER DEALERSHIP EMPLOYEES. THEIR OPINION IS THE SAME. THEY ALL BELIEVE THAT IT TAKES TIME FOR THIS TYPE OF FAILURE TO OCCUR. AND NOT ONE OF THE SPECIALISTS HAVE EVER SEEN THIS PROBLEM WITH A CAR LESS THAN 100,000 MILES DRIVEN! WE HAVE CONTACTED CHRYLSER FOR A REFUND OF THE TOTAL COST OF THE REPLACEMENT OF OUR PLYMOUTH BREEZE'S NEW TRANSMITTION.

ON NOVEMBER 15TH, 1998, MY HUSBAND WAS DRIVING OUR PLYMOUTH BREEZE ON HIS WAY TO WORK. WHILE DRIVING HE HEARD SEVERAL TERRIBLE, LOUD NOISES COMING FROM UNDER THE HOOD AND IMMEDIATELY LOSS POWER. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO AAMCO TRANSMITTIONS. AAMCO TRANSMITTIONS FOUND THE PROBLEM TO BE, THE DIFFERENTAL PIN WORKED ITS WAY OUT OF PLACE, CATCHING ITSELF ON METAL. THE DIFFERENTIAL PIN SPLIT INTO THREE PIECES (AAMCO BELIEVES). THE DIFFERENTIAL PIN MADE SEVERAL 3 INCH HOLES IN THE CASING OF THE TRANSMISSION. THE TRANSMISSION WAS CONTAMINATED AND DESTROYED. THE SOLUTION, TO REPLACE THE COMPLETE TRANSMISSION. THE PLYMOUTH BREEZE IN THIS REPORT HAS NOT EVER BEEN SERVICED FOR PROBLEMS OTHER THAN RECALLS. WE BELIEVE THE DAMAGE STARTED TO BEGIN WHILE THE CAR WAS STILL IN ITS WARRANTY LIFE. WE HAVE SPOKEN TO TWO CHRYSLER ENGINEERS, TWO TRANSMISSION SPECIALISTS, AND THREE CHRYLSER DEALERSHIP EMPLOYEES. THEIR OPINION IS THE SAME. THEY ALL BELIEVE THAT IT TAKES TIME FOR THIS TYPE OF FAILURE TO OCCUR. AND NOT ONE OF THE SPECIALISTS HAVE EVER SEEN THIS PROBLEM WITH A CAR LESS THAN 100,000 MILES DRIVEN! WE HAVE CONTACTED CHRYLSER FOR A REFUND OF THE TOTAL COST OF THE REPLACEMENT OF OUR PLYMOUTH BREEZE'S NEW TRANSMITTION.

CONSUMER HAS BEEN EXPERIENCING PROBLEMS WITH BRAKES.  REPLACED BRAKES TWICE SINCE OWNING VEHICLE. . WHEN  APPLYING  BRAKES, CONSUMER'S  FOOT WENT  TO THE FLOORBOARD, LOST CONTROL, RESULTING IN A COLLISION/ FATALITY. MANUFACTURER HAS BEEN CONTACTED.  *AK

LOW OIL PRESSURE INDICATOR FAILURE.  SUGGESTS FACTORY DEFECTS AND/OR DESIGN DEFICIENCIES.  SLOW OIL LOSS FROM SMALL HOLE IN OIL PAN OVER PERIOD OF AT LEAST 6 DAYS FAILED TO ACTIVATE WARNINGS PRIOR TO ENGINE SEIZE UP. EST 3/4 QT OIL REMAINING AFTER ENGINE SEIZED BUT WARN  LITE DID NOT COME ON UNTIL ENGINE STOPPED.  VEH WAS IN BUSY TRAFFIC WHEN ENGINE UNEXPECTLY  AND ABRUPTLY STOPPED AND WOULD NOT RESTART. OIL PAN FAILURE RESULTED FROM SCRAPING CONTACT OVER TIME WITH ROAD SURFACES ON DIPS DUE TO PAN DESIGN AND LOWNESS OF VEH THE PAN HAS A LOWERD DETENT JUST BEFORE DRAIN PLUG WHICH APPEARS TO BE FIRST POINT OF IMPACT WHEN DIPS ARE ENCOUNTERED.  REPEATED CONTACTS DID NOT DAMAGE OVERALL PAN  BUT LEFT UNPROTECTED THE DETENT WHICH SCRAPED OR WORE THRU METAL AND ALLOWED OIL LEAKAGE. OIL PAN SHOULD BE STRENGHTENED OR PROTECTED AT THAT POINT TO PRECLUDE  REOCCURRANCE.  THIS FAILURE IN CONCERT WITH OIL WARNING LITE FAILURE  CAUSING VEHICLE ABRUPT STOPPAGES IN TRAFFIC COULD RESULT IN SERIOUS ACCIDENTS WITH ACCOMPANING P

CONSUMER STATED THAT  THE REMEDY DID NOT CORRECT THE PROBLEM. RECALL NUMBER 98V183000. *AK   THE DEALER SAID THAT THE FAULTY COMPONENT FUNCTIONED AS DESIGNED. HOWEVER, THE RECALL NOTICE SAID THAT WHEN THE TRANSMISSION CAME OUT OF PARK WITH THE KEY REMOVED, WHICH IT DOES, OR IF THE KEY CAME OUT OF THE IGNITION SWITCH WITHOUT BEING TURNED TO THE OFF POSITION, WHICH IT DOES, THE IGNITION INTERLOCK CABLE WAS DEFECTIVE AND NEEDED TO BE REPLACED.  *YD

CYLINDER HEAD GASKETS ON PLYMOUTH BREEZES, DODGE STRATUS, AND CRYSLER CIRRUS ARE FAILING. I LIVE IN A SMALL TOWN OF 600 PEOPLE 4 PEOPLE WHO OWN THESE TYPES OF VEHILES HAVE EXPERIENCED THE SAME PROBLEM. WHEN TEDS REAPIRED IT THEY  HAD TO BACK ORDER BECAUSE THEY HAVE HAD TO REPLACE SO MANY AND THE ONES THAT THEY ARE REPLACEING THEM WITH ARE UPDATED. I INFORMED CRYSLER AND THEY SAID TO FILE A COMPLAINT WITH YOU.

DEALER CONTACED ON ALL OCCASIONS. DEALER ENCOURAGED ME TO DRIVE CAR WITH A CRACKED HEAD GASKET AND STATED NO DAMAGE WOULD OCCUR UNTIL PART CAME IN. DEALER CHECKED SEAT LUNGING FORWARD AND STATED THAT IS HOW IT IS MADE. DEALER STATES HE CANNOT HEAR RACK AND PINION NOISE FROM STEERING COLUMN.DEALER STATED FAILED BRAKES ARE WEAR AND TEAR. MUST WAIT 5 WEEKS FOR AN EGR PART TO COME IN SINCE THEY ARE IN SUCH HIGH DEMAND AND ON BACKORDER. DO NOT BUY THIS CAR. MANURACTURER DOES NOT STAND BY THEIR PRODUCT.
CONSUMER NOTICED OIL COMING FROM UNDER THE VEHICLE, AND THE CONSUMER CONTACTED THE DEALER.   DEALER SAID THAT THE HEAD GASKET WAS CRACKED. *AK
HEAD GASKET IS LEAKING WHICH IS CAUSING HARM TO ENGINE.PLEASE ADD MORE INFORMATION.  *AK
BRAKING SUSTEM IS DEFECTIVE. REPLACED  ROTORS/PADS AND CALIPERS THREE TIMES WITHIN A YEAR. DEALER NOTIFIED, AND RFUSES TO REPAIR UNLESS COST GOES TO CONSUMER.  *AK
COVERING  ON STEERING WHEEL IS PREMATURELY WEARING OFF, CAUSING STEERING TO BE DIFFICULT WHILE DRIVING.  *AK
REAR MAIN SEAL IS LEAKING OIL. DEALER NOTIFIED, AND INFORMED CONSUMER TO TRY TO GET A RECALL OR FIX IT AT HIS OWN EXPENSE.  *AK

WHILE EITHER PARKED OR DRIVING VEHICLE KEEPS LEAKING OIL. POWER WOULD DROP WHEN PULLING FROM STOP SIGN OR LIGHT. TOOK TO DEALER & EACH TIME OIL WAS REPLACED TO THE MOTOR. THE FLUID THAT'S LEAKING OUT LOOKS RED. MECHANIC CANNOT LOCATE LEAKING PROBLEM.  *AK

WHEN APPLYING THE BRAKES THERE IS A NOISE WHICH INDICATES MORE WEAR AND TEAR ON THE BRAKING SYSTEM.  DEALER SAID THEY FIXED THE PROBLEM. PROBLEM STILL EXISTS. ALSO,   STEERING WHEEL  BECOMES "STIFF AND HARD." OCCUPANT CANNOT CONTROL THE VEHICLE. IN ADDITION,  PROBLEMS WITH TRANSMISSION, WHEN THE OCCUPANT ACCELERATES THE VEHICLE DOES NOT "PERFORM AS IT SHOULD".  CAUSES UNKNOWN.  PLEASE PROVIDE DETAILS.  *AK
ENGINE FAILURE.
VEHICLE MAKES NOISE WHEN TURNING TO THE RIGHT.
STEERING PUMP, STEERING COLUMN FAILURE.
DOOR LOCK MOTOR TO LEFT REAR DOOR MAKES NOISE EACH ALTERNATING TIME THE POWER DOOR LOCK BUTTON IS USED.
MASTER CYLINDER LEAKED DUE TO DAMAGED DOUBLE LIP REAR PISTON SEAL  PRIOR TO RECALL, RECALL REPAIRS REFUSED DUE TO VIN (96V-075).

CONSUMER CONTACTED THE DEALER  IN REFERENCE TO RECALL 97V095000, MANUFACTURER'S NUMBER 734. DEALER REPLACED PARTS ON A NUMBER OF OCCASIONS, PARTS REPLACED DID NOT CORRECT PROBLEM. CONSUMER STILL HAVING PROBLEMS WITH THE HOOD LATCH. PLEASE PROVIDE ANY FURTHER DETAILS.  *AK
BRAKE ROTORS OVERHEATING CAUSING DAMAGE.
BRAKE PADS CRACKED DUE TO OVERHEATING.
WHEN BRAKES ARE APPLIED THE PEDAL GOES TO THE FLOOR , RESULTING IN EXTENDED STOPPING DISTANCES.  THE MANUFACTURER HAS BEEN NOTIFIED.  *AK
SEVERE OIL LEAKAGE IN CAR HAS CAUSED PROBLEMS, AND OIL HAS TO BE CHECKED EVERYDAY.  VEHICLE IS NOT UNDER WARRANTY. DEALER HAS STATED THAT IT IS POSSIBLE  OF A FAULTY  ENGINE GASKET.
REAR CENTER SEAT BELT IS ALWAYS TOO LOOSE AND HAS TO BE RESET EVERY TIME THEY STRAP THE CHILD IN.
